bibl.title: Michael Henan v. John H. McGraw. Petition for Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court for the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.p: Territory of Washington County of King } ss
In the matter of the application of Michael Henen for discharge on a Writ of Habeas Corpus
To the Honorable Roger S. Greene Judge of the District Court, for the third judicial District of Washington Territory holding terms at Seattle. --

1 Your petitioner Michael Henan humbly represents to your Honor that he is unlawfully restrained of his liberty by J.H. McGraw Sheriff and jailer of said King County, and at the jail in the said County; the said jail being the County jail-
2 That the cause or pretense of your petitioners restraint is a charge of grand larceny, of which your petitioner avers that he is not guilty,
3 That the illegality of your petitioners restraint consists
in detaining your petitioner without evidence or facts sufficient to justify the same.
4 That your petitioner is a young man and is descious of establishing his innocence at an early a date as possible. -

5 That your petitioner is ill + very ill in the said jail, - your petitioner being sarcly - afflicted with a complaint which will, added to much longer imprisonment to wit on the October term of your honor sitting surely bring about such awful consequences that your petitioner cannot ever recover from the effecets of the same. -

Wherefore your petitioner prays this Honorable Court to grant unto him the gracious Writ of Habeas Corpus commanding the said J.H. McGraw Sheriff and jailer as aforesaid to produce the body of this your petitioner before your honor

on same day certain, and also command the said JH McGraw to summon + bring forth the witnesses charging your petitioner with the offense for which he is deprived of his liberty, + then + there at such time as named by your honor, to enquire wherefore this your petitioner is so illegaly restrained of his liberty and your petitioner will pray for discharge etc.
Michael Henan by Jas. H. Lewis his atty at law + on behalf of said Henan
Territory of Washington } ss County of King

Before me Luthene Christopher Gilman a notary public for and in King County Washington Territory appeared James H. Lewis who being duly sworn on oath deposes and says, that he is attorney for foregoing named petitioner Michael Henan + and this petition is made by him on behalf of said Henan, that he has read the foregoing petition, knows its contents + believes the same to be true -
Jas. H. Lewis Sworn to + subscribed before me this 2d day of August AD 1885
S. Notary Public for Washington Territory
Territory of Washington, } ss County of King.

_____ being first duly sworn, on oath says: That he is the _____ _____ in the above entitled action: that he has heard the foregoing _____ read, knows the contents therof, and believes the same to be true; that he makes this affidavit because _____ L.C. Gilman
In the District Court, Third Judicial District, holding terms at Seattle, Washington Territory.
In re- Michael Henan vs. J.H. McGraw for writ of Habeas Corpus
Petition
FILED AUG 21 1885 By James Seavey, Clerk. By James Ludlow, Deputy Clerk.
Jas. H. Lewis Attorneys for pett.
